intro: Aristea pusilla subsp. robustior, commonly known as the dwarf aristea, is a small, mat-forming succulent native to South Africa. It features dense, woolly foliage that is typically green to bluish-gray in color. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to orange, often blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appeal make it a valuable addition to arid landscape designs.
